objects.name: NCSC
objects.description: Primary author and publisher of the report; provided technical analysis, detections, Sigma, and YARA rules. The report is © Crown Copyright 2022 and authored by NCSC.

objects.name: SparrowDoor C2 domain
objects.description: Command and control (C2) domain hardcoded in SparrowDoor configuration and used for HTTPS communications.

objects.name: Configured proxy IP
objects.description: Proxy IP address specified in SparrowDoor configuration for outbound C2 communications if direct connection fails.

objects.name: SparrowDoor mutex
objects.description: Mutex created by SparrowDoor to ensure a single instance on the victim host.

objects.name: Persistence service key
objects.description: Primary persistence mechanism where SparrowDoor installs SearchIndexer.exe as a Windows service.

objects.name: Persistence Run key value
objects.description: Backup persistence mechanism where SparrowDoor adds SearchIndexer.exe to the Run key for autostart.

objects.name: Malware staging directory
objects.description: Directory on victim host where SparrowDoor components were recovered and stored.

objects.name: SearchIndexer.exe (renamed Notepad++ updater)
objects.description: Signed Notepad++ updater renamed and used by SparrowDoor for DLL side-loading and persistence.

objects.name: libcurl.dll (SparrowDoor loader)
objects.description: Malicious loader DLL side-loaded by SearchIndexer.exe to load the SparrowDoor backdoor.

objects.name: libhost.dll (SparrowDoor backdoor container)
objects.description: Obfuscated container file holding SparrowDoor backdoor and reflective loader shellcode.

objects.name: Clipboard log file
objects.description: File created by SparrowDoor 'clipshot' feature to log clipboard data every second.

objects.name: Indicator for libcurl.dll (MD5)
objects.description: MD5 hash of SparrowDoor loader DLL.

objects.name: Indicator for libcurl.dll (SHA1)
objects.description: SHA-1 hash of SparrowDoor loader DLL.

objects.name: Indicator for libcurl.dll (SHA256)
objects.description: SHA-256 hash of SparrowDoor loader DLL.

objects.name: Indicator for libhost.dll (MD5)
objects.description: MD5 hash of SparrowDoor backdoor container file.

objects.name: Indicator for libhost.dll (SHA1)
objects.description: SHA-1 hash of SparrowDoor backdoor container file.

objects.name: Indicator for libhost.dll (SHA256)
objects.description: SHA-256 hash of SparrowDoor backdoor container file.

objects.name: Indicator for SearchIndexer.exe (renamed GUP.exe) (MD5)
objects.description: MD5 hash of the signed Notepad++ updater used and renamed by SparrowDoor to SearchIndexer.exe for side-loading.

objects.name: Indicator for SearchIndexer.exe (renamed GUP.exe) (SHA1)
objects.description: SHA-1 hash of the signed Notepad++ updater used and renamed by SparrowDoor to SearchIndexer.exe for side-loading.

objects.name: Indicator for SearchIndexer.exe (renamed GUP.exe) (SHA256)
objects.description: SHA-256 hash of the signed Notepad++ updater used and renamed by SparrowDoor to SearchIndexer.exe for side-loading.

objects.name: sparrowdoor
objects.description: SparrowDoor is a persistent 32-bit Windows loader and backdoor variant identified on a UK network in 2021. It achieves execution via DLL side-loading (malicious libcurl.dll) into a renamed signed Notepad++ updater (SearchIndexer.exe), then reflectively loads an obfuscated backdoor payload from libhost.dll. The malware implements defence evasion including inline API hooks, AV process detection, token impersonation (using explorer.exe’s token), process injection into a suspended svchost.exe, masquerading with legitimate names, and indicator cleanup. It communicates with C2 over HTTPS using static XOR-encoded data beneath TLS, supports proxy usage, and runs a variable beaconing loop. Tasking includes file read/write/delete/rename, directory listing, reverse shell, clipboard logging (“clipshot”) via rundll32.exe, environment-variable-based cleanup, and exfiltration over the C2 channel.

objects.name: ESET
objects.description: Cited industry source that reported a previous SparrowDoor variant in September 2021; referenced for prior analysis context.

objects.name: Kaspersky
objects.description: Anti-virus vendor referenced via the AV process name 'avp.exe' in SparrowDoor’s security software discovery routine.

objects.name: ESET (product reference)
objects.description: Referenced via the AV process name 'egui.exe' in SparrowDoor’s security software discovery routine.

objects.name: Symantec
objects.description: Anti-virus vendor referenced via the AV process names 'ccSetMgr.exe', 'ccSvcHst.exe', and 'ccapp.exe' in SparrowDoor’s security software discovery routine.

objects.name: Trend Micro
objects.description: Anti-virus vendor referenced via the AV process name 'TMBMSRV.exe' in SparrowDoor’s security software discovery routine.

objects.name: Comodo
objects.description: Referenced via 'Comodo Firewall Pro' associated with the process 'cpf.exe' in SparrowDoor’s security software discovery routine.

objects.name: McAfee
objects.description: Anti-virus vendor referenced via the AV process name 'Mcshield.exe' in SparrowDoor’s security software discovery routine.

objects.name: 360.cn (Qihoo 360)
objects.description: Security vendor referenced via the AV process name 'ZhuDongFangYu.exe' in SparrowDoor’s security software discovery routine.

objects.name: T1543.003
objects.description: SparrowDoor achieves persistence by installing SearchIndexer.exe as a Windows service, using parameters defined in the malware configuration.

objects.name: T1547.001
objects.description: If SparrowDoor fails to persist as a Windows Service, it installs SearchIndexer.exe in the CurrentVersion\Run key.

objects.name: T1134.001
objects.description: SparrowDoor impersonates the user account token associated with the explorer.exe process.

objects.name: T1140
objects.description: The SparrowDoor malware file libhost.dll is obfuscated with a 4-byte XOR key and the configuration is obfuscated with an 8-byte XOR key.

objects.name: T1574.002
objects.description: The SparrowDoor malware gains execution when the malware file libcurl.dll is side-loaded by SearchIndexer.exe.

objects.name: T1055.012
objects.description: SparrowDoor injects itself into a spawned and suspended instance of svchost.exe during initialisation.

objects.name: T1070.004
objects.description: SparrowDoor can be tasked to remove arbitrary files from the host and to delete files specific to the malware’s execution as part of a clean-up routine.

objects.name: T1620
objects.description: SparrowDoor is loaded by a reflective loader found in libhost.dll.

objects.name: T1036.005
objects.description: A legitimate and signed Notepad++ updater has been renamed SearchIndexer.exe and the malware also uses the name libcurl.dll for its loader to match legitimate names and locations.

objects.name: T1218
objects.description: SparrowDoor is side-loaded into, and hijacks execution of, a signed Notepad++ updater.

objects.name: T1518.001
objects.description: SparrowDoor checks the running processes against a list of hardcoded AV names.

objects.name: T1071.001
objects.description: SparrowDoor uses HTTPS as a command and control (C2) channel and is proxy aware.

objects.name: T1573.001
objects.description: SparrowDoor uses static XOR keys to encode data when it is being sent or received over the C2 channel.

objects.name: T1115
objects.description: SparrowDoor can be tasked to launch clipboard logging functionality.

objects.name: T1041
objects.description: SparrowDoor can be tasked to exfiltrate files from disk over its C2 channel.

objects.name: SparrowDoor_apipatch
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule SparrowDoor_apipatch {
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"

  description = "Identifies code segments in SparrowDoor
responsible for patching APIs. No MZ/PE match as the backdoor has no
header. Targeting in memory."
        date = "2022-02-28"
        hash1 = "c1890a6447c991880467b86a013dbeaa66cc615f"
    strings:
        $save = {8B 06 89 07 8A 4E 04} // save off first 5 bytes of
function

  $vp_1 = {89 10 8A 4E 04 8B D6 2B D0 88 48 04 83 EA 05 C6 40 05 E9

89 50 06} // calculate long jump

  $vp_2 = {50 8B D6 6A 40 2B D7 88 4F 04 83 EA 05 6A 05 C6 47 05 E9

89 57 06 56} // calculate long jump 2

  $vp_3 = {51 52 2B DE 6A 05 83 EB 05 56 C6 06 E9 89 5E 01} //

restore memory protections

  $va = {6A 40 68 00 10 00 00 68 00 10 00 00 6A 00} // virtually

alloc set size, allocation and protection

  $s_patch = {50 68 7F FF FF FF 68 FF FF 00 00 56} // socket patch

SO_DONTLINGER

    condition:

    3 of them

}

objects.name: SparrowDoor_clipshot
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
import "pe"
rule SparrowDoor_clipshot {
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"

  description = "The SparrowDoor loader contains a feature it calls

clipshot, which logs clipboard data to a file."
        date = "2022-02-28"
        hash1 = "989b3798841d06e286eb083132242749c80fdd4d"
    strings:
        $exsting_cmp = {8B 1E 3B 19 75 ?? 83 E8 04 83 C1 04 83 C6 04 83
F8 04} // comparison routine for previous clipboard data

  $time_format_string = "%d/%d/%d %d:%d" ascii
  $cre_fil_args = {6A 00 68 80 00 00 00 6A 04 6A 00 6A 02 68 00 00

00 40 52}
    condition:
        (uint16(0) == 0x5A4D) and uint32(uint32(0x3C)) == 0x00004550 and
all of them and (pe.imports("User32.dll","OpenClipboard") and
pe.imports("User32.dll","GetClipboardData") and
pe.imports("Kernel32.dll","GetLocalTime") and
pe.imports("Kernel32.dll","GlobalSize"))

}

objects.name: SparrowDoor_config
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule SparrowDoor_config {
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"

  description = "Targets the XOR encoded loader config and
shellcode in the file libhost.dll using the known position of the XOR
key."
        date = "2022-02-28"
        hash1 = "c1890a6447c991880467b86a013dbeaa66cc615f"
    condition:
        (uint16(0) != 0x5A4D) and
        (uint16(0) != 0x8b55) and

  (uint32(0) ^ uint32(0x4c) ==  0x00) and
  (uint32(0) ^ uint32(0x34) ==  0x00) and
  (uint16(0) ^ uint16(0x50) ==  0x8b55)

}

objects.name: SparrowDoor_loader
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule SparrowDoor_loader {
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"

  description = "Targets code features of the SparrowDoor loader.

This rule detects the previous variant and this new variant."
        date = "2022-02-28"
        hash1 = "989b3798841d06e286eb083132242749c80fdd4d"
    strings:

  $xor_algo = {8B D0 83 E2 03 8A 54 14 10 30 14 30 40 3B C1}
  $rva = {8D B0 [4] 8D 44 24 ?? 50 6A 40 6A 05 56} // load RVA of

process exe
        $lj = {2B CE 83 E9 05 8D [3] 52 C6 06 E9 89 4E 01 8B [3] 50 6A 05
56} // calculate long jump
    condition:
        (uint16(0) == 0x5A4D) and uint32(uint32(0x3C)) == 0x00004550 and
all of them

}

objects.name: SparrowDoor_shellcode
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.

objects.name: SparrowDoor_sleep_routine
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule SparrowDoor_sleep_routine {
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "SparrowDoor implements a Sleep routine with value
seeded on GetTickCount. This signature detects the previous and this
variant of SparrowDoor. No MZ/PE match as the backdoor has no header.
Targeting in memory."
        date = "2022-02-28"
        hash1 = "c1890a6447c991880467b86a013dbeaa66cc615f"

    strings:
        $sleep = {FF D7 33 D2 B9 [4] F7 F1 81 C2 [4] 8B C2 C1 E0 04 2B C2
03 C0 03 C0 03 C0 50}

    condition:

  all of them

}

objects.name: SparrowDoor_xor
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule SparrowDoor_xor {
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"

  description = "Highlights XOR routines in SparrowDoor. No MZ/PE

match as the backdoor has no header. Targeting in memory."
        date = "2022-02-28"
        hash1 = "c1890a6447c991880467b86a013dbeaa66cc615f"
    strings:
        $xor_routine_outbound = {B8 39 8E E3 38 F7 E1 D1 EA 8D 14 D2 8B
C1 2B C2 8A [4] 00 30 14 39 41 3B CE}

  $xor_routine_inbound = {B8 25 49 92 24 F7 E1 8B C1 2B C2 D1 E8 03

C2 C1 E8 02 8D 14 C5 [4] 2B D0 8B C1 2B C2}
        $xor_routine_config = {8B D9 83 E3 07 0F [6] 30 18 8D 1C 07 83 E3
07 0F [6] 30 58 01 8D 1C 28 83 E3 07 0F [6] 30 58 02 8D 1C 02 83 E3 07 0F
[6] 30 58 03 8B DE 83 E3 07 0F [6] 30 58 04 83 C6 05 83 C1 05}
    condition:
        2 of them
}

objects.name: SparrowDoor_strings
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule SparrowDoor_strings {
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "Strings that appear in SparrowDoor's backdoor.
Targeting in memory."
        date = "2022-02-28"
        hash1 = "c1890a6447c991880467b86a013dbeaa66cc615f"

    strings:
        $reg = "Software\\Microsoft\\Windows\\CurrentVersion\\Run" ascii

$http_headers = {55 73 65 72 2D 41 67 65 6E 74 3A 20 4D 6F 7A 69 6C

6C 61 2F 34 2E 30 20 28 63 6F 6D 70 61 74 69 62 6C 65 3B 20 4D 53 49 45
20 35 2E 30 3B 20 57 69 6E 64 6F 77 73 20 4E 54 20 35 2E 30 29 0D 0A 41
63 63 65 70 74 2D 4C 61 6E 67 75 61 67 65 3A 20 65 6E 2D 55 53 0D 0A 41
63 63 65 70 74 3A 20 2A 2F 2A 0D 0A}

$http_proxy = "HTTPS=HTTPS://%s:%d" ascii
$debug = "SeDebugPrivilege" ascii
$av1 = "avp.exe" ascii // Kaspersky
$av2 = "ZhuDongFangYu.exe" ascii // Qihoo360
$av3 = "egui.exe" ascii // ESET
$av4 = "TMBMSRV.exe" ascii // Trend Micro
$av5 = "ccSetMgr.exe" ascii // Norton
$clipshot = "clipshot" ascii
$ComSpec =  "ComSpec" ascii
$export = "curl_easy_init" ascii

    condition:
        10 of them
}

objects.name: Analisi Malware: Sparrowdoor
objects.description: This report contains technical analysis and indicators associated with malware. sparrowdoor.
